CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: This apparently demonstrates that , in agreement with earlier studies and experimental studies , 17 the replacement of thiophene with selenophene results in a reduction of the optical bandgap due to the increase of quinoid character in the polymer backbone.

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: This apparently demonstrates that , in agreement with earlier studies and experimental studies , 17 the replacement of thiophene with selenophene results in a reduction of the optical bandgap due to the increase of quinoid character in the polymer backbone.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| optical bandgap |
| quinoid character |
| polymer backbone |

In this paragraph, "optical bandgap" and "quinoid character" are the property names mentioned. The "polymer backbone" is also a property name, but it is not explicitly stated as such in the paragraph. However, it can be inferred that it is being referred to as the part of the polymer that is undergoing a change in character when thiophene is replaced with selenophene.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| optical bandgap |

In the revised version of the paragraph, only "optical bandgap" is the property name mentioned that clearly refers to a material property. The term "quinoid character" can be considered a descriptor or a parameter that affects the material property, but it is not a property itself. Therefore, it is not included in the table.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: This apparently demonstrates that , in agreement with earlier studies and experimental studies , 17 the replacement of thiophene with selenophene results in a reduction of the optical bandgap due to the increase of quinoid character in the polymer backbone.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value                   |
|--------------------------------|
| optical bandgap                |
| reduction of optical bandgap    |
| quinoid character             |
| polymer backbone               |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value                   |
|--------------------------------|
| optical bandgap reduction       |
| quinoid character             |

Note: "reduction of optical bandgap" is equivalent to "optical bandgap reduction" and both refer to the same property value. Therefore, I kept only one of them in the table.
